intro: Pteroceras javanicum, commonly known as the Java pteroceras, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrsinaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered at the base of the leaves. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Pteroceras javanicum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
